First describe: The Royal Castle in Warsaw for many centuries was the center of the authority firstly of Mazovia, and then of the entire Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth. It became the residency of the King of Poland since the kingship of Zygmunt Waze the third. The Royal Castle was completly destroyed during the World War II down to the German bombings during the September campaign.
Nowadays: The Royal Castle was rebuilt in 70s by the decision of the central comitet of the Polish United Workers' Party. Today, after few redecorations, it is one of the most iconic symbol of the Warsaw and the whole Poland
